title: Amanda Holden rushed into surgery after breaking leg in two places
text:
Amanda has broken her leg while on holiday (Picture: REX/@AmandaHolden)

Amanda Holden has been rushed into surgery while on holiday in Europe after breaking her leg in two places.

The 48-year-old star had a nasty incident while taking a well-earned break in Europe alongside husband Chris Hughes.

Britain’s Got Talent’s Amanda was playing with her daughters Alexa, 13, and Hollie, seven, in the sea when she snapped her fibula in two places, ending up in a local hospital.

It was said she lost her footing and slipped while on a Total Wipeout-style assault course in the water.

Confirming the news on Monday night, Amanda said: ‘Sadly this is true. I suffered a nasty accident while playing in the sea with the family during our half-term holiday and subsequently broke my leg in two places.

‘I had an operation on Friday and a metal plate was fitted.’

The star made a public appearance last week before jetting away (Picture: Rex Features)

Today the star further elaborated on her injury, as she called into her Heart Breakfast show and gave Jamie Theakston the goss.

Not being able to believe it happened on the first day of her holiday, the ‘gutted star’ said: ‘Yeah so basically I was trying to be a good mother Jamie and I put my book down, I put down the Uno cards… and I said to Hollie “Mummy can come on that with you” and there’s this like, you remember [Total] Wipeout, that TV thing? There’s like a children’s Total Wipeout thing in the middle of the sea and … mistily get round it and I thought yeah I can do that.

‘So Hollie was doing brilliantly and going round it. I walked around it and then crawled across like an old person, like across the difficult bits.

‘And then there were these three inflatable stepping stones in the middle of the sea and everyone else was running across it and I thought “oh I could do that, if kids can do it I can do it” and I did it and I made it – I was showing off Jamie – I made it across to the other side and then my leg slipped ’cause obviously its wet, like an inflatable thing in the sea, my leg slipped and it went the other way and I felt it break and I fell in to the sea and I had to swim back to the shore one-legged.’

That sounds way too painful to comprehend this early in the day.

Confirming she broke it in two places, she said she didn’t have a cast, but has got ‘metal in my leg and a splint and it’s all wrapped up and it’s got a heartbeat in it’.

Advertisement

‘The irony is is you know how much I hate health and safety and a guy that was running the thing said “you have to wear the life jacket” and I was thinking well this is silly, it’s a children’s thing,’ Amanda continued. ‘So I was like “ugh alright then” and I put on the life jacket I’m really glad I did to be honest because I don’t think I would have made it back as hastily as I did.’

Earlier Amanda posted a shot of herself with her right leg all bandaged up. She didn’t look too pleased with her current situation, as she gave the camera a thumbs down.

‘Heart Break fast ! 💔 #leg,’ she wrote alongside the photo, which saw a pair of crutches leaning against the lounge she was propped up on.

Not a fun way to spend a Euro break.

The star loves a seaside escape

She’s not wasting time wallowing, though, as a rep confirmed the star would be back in the hot seat on her Heart radio show pronto.

They said: ‘Despite this painful accident it’s business as usual for Amanda and she will return to Heart Breakfast on Monday 28th October.’

There’s no Holden Amanda back!

The star has been a busy bee recently, taking her daughter along to a press junket with Angelina Jolie for Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil.

Sitting in front of Angelina (who plays Maleficent) and Elle Fanning (Princess Aurora), young Hollie didn’t look even a smidge starstruck, as she happily asked questions of the Hollywood stars.

Advertisement

Taking the reins for the final question, Amanda asked Angelina in particular how important it was for her to play roles ‘that gently give a message to younger people’.

‘When you know a large part of the audience is young, I think usually it’s the adults that need to be reminded of these messages,’ Angelina said.

She added: ‘The message that family is not just blood, you know, half of my children are not my blood but they are absolutely my family and my children and I love them so much.

‘It’s very important to understand there are lots of different ways to have family.’

Tune in to Heart Breakfast weekdays from 6.30am-10am.
